column5: If thats Roy, the muskies only about 36" long !! lol
aint nothing wrong with Labatts 50! I am a "young gun" and I enjoy it
Real Redcap or Skol stubbies  and green export "A"s .   Colts,   Baby Duck to seal the deal.    Hortons Breakfast

Came across this pic surfing around the net.  It was too good not to share - gotta love the burns, glasses, the hat and the the pose - gotta give'em credit he's doin' the horizontal hold,,,,heck he probably pioneered it  It's one SOLID fish though    Cheers, Gman
Great pic, Gavin. They look like Montreal dudes..... I don't know why.
Admit it Roy, he managed to get an old pic of yours and posted it here!  LOL  Mike
oh man that is a great look.  That style of hat is definitely back in too
Great pic!  The logo on the hat looks like the state of Ohio. Don't know if it is but it sure looks like it.  Whopper
That guy had to hold the fish horizontaly because it was soo heavy.
lol, he looks like a wrestler about to do a back breaker on the musky!
Ahhhhh, Montreal, where the men are men, and so are the women, uh?
yes thats very old pic,you can tell by the equiptment and by the looks of the boats....
Funny how everybody's checkin' out the dudes rather than the monster musky! haha
Love the mutton chops. What a fat pig that girl is, any idea on where it was landed? Thanks Gman, great find.   Cheers, 1leg
Probably not a Photoshoped Pic either.
Hi Gman,  Great pic of a nice musky.  Sam
HAHa, looks like a half hippy, half mechanic and a third fisherman if that's possible.lol..nice fish to.  That must be from yesterday looking at the eclipse with those coke bottle glasses.
Hey Baby Herc I invite to come check out the nice looking french women in Montreal.Very pretty ladies here and I know alot of guys from Ontario who would agree.MTP
or what?  You don't need the good ole days to catch them like that. Go fish Lake St. Clair.
Like Phil says the logo on the hat is Ohio, boat looks like a early bass boat late 60`S early 70`s? Ohio`s record is like 55 pounds. Nice fish though where ever it was caught! Did they eat it? LOL

You have to admit there were some great days back then when no one cared about the future because nature would always replenish for years to come.  Yes we were short sighted then but it still was a hell of a lot of fun when you didn't worry about every thing you did and how you did it.  But now back to the reality of today.........
Looks like some of the water I fish on Pigeon.
Just some "good ole boys".
Only thing missing is a smoke hanging from the mouth.    Great fish
I bet they were drinkin Labbat's 50 as well!! Those glasses are back in now aren't they?!!  Rob C
Oh the good ole days... i aggree it does look a bit like roy...
Oh, I don't know What do you think Gman?  Hats, shirts, polorized glasses, sun screen
Rob C I hear Ya, So Funny
